title: Missing Cache-Control Header in HTTP Responses
description: HTTP responses lack the Cache-Control header, which is the primary mechanism for controlling caching behavior in HTTP/1.1. Without Cache-Control, caches must fall back to heuristic caching rules which may be inappropriate for the resource type. This can lead to resources being cached when they shouldn't be, or vice versa. The vulnerability affects all endpoints including HTML (index), CSS stylesheets, JavaScript files, and image assets. No fallback headers (Pragma or Expires) are provided for HTTP/1.0 compatibility.
impact: Missing Cache-Control header results in: (1) Ambiguous caching behavior - caches will use heuristic expiration (typically 10% of age since modification), (2) Sensitive resources may be cached indefinitely in shared caches, (3) Dynamic content may not update properly for users, (4) No explicit control over cache validity, (5) Potential security issues if sensitive resources are cached on proxy servers or CDNs, (6) Browser caches may serve stale content unpredictably, (7) Static assets cannot leverage long-term caching for performance optimization
evidence:
POC executed successfully demonstrating missing Cache-Control headers across all tested endpoints:

- http://localhost:8080/ (HTML) - Missing Cache-Control
- http://localhost:8080/styles.css (CSS) - Missing Cache-Control
- http://localhost:8080/scripts.js (JavaScript) - Missing Cache-Control
- http://localhost:8080/dev1.jpeg (Image) - Missing Cache-Control
- http://localhost:8080/dev2.jpeg (Image) - Missing Cache-Control

All responses show only: Server, Date, Content-type, Content-Length, Last-Modified headers. No Cache-Control, Pragma, or Expires headers present. The server (SimpleHTTP/0.6 Python/3.13.3) does not implement cache control headers by default.

Sample response header from /styles.css:
HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Server: SimpleHTTP/0.6 Python/3.13.3
Date: Thu, 06 Nov 2025 19:47:34 GMT
Content-type: text/css
Content-Length: 341
Last-Modified: Thu, 06 Nov 2025 19:32:29 GMT

[NO Cache-Control header]
references: RFC 7234 (HTTP Caching), RFC 7231 (Cache-Control Header Field), OWASP - Caching Controls, CWE-524 (Use of Cache Containing Sensitive Information)
toolCallDescription: Document missing Cache-Control header vulnerability with working POC demonstrating absence across all application endpoints
